Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant met the residency requirement under paragraph 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act despite absences from Canada
Application_Facts: Applicant was physically present for 621 days out of the required 1095; temporarily left Canada to join spouse working abroad; maintained Canadian employment and tax ties
Court_Ruling: Appeal allowed; case remanded for proper assessment of whether absence was temporary and life centralized in Canada
Grounds_for_Claim: Citizenship judge failed to properly assess temporary nature of absence and centrality of applicant's life in Canada
Legal_Standard: Three years of physical residence in Canada within four years before application; temporary absences may count if ties to Canada are maintained
Assessment_Factor: Temporary nature of absence, maintenance of connections to Canada (employment, taxes)
Procedural_Issue: Appeal heard by Federal Court - Trial Division under new rules treating appeals as applications rather than trials de novo
Evidence_Used: Physical presence records, employment records, tax payment records
Application_Basis: Residency calculation and intent to maintain Canadian residence during temporary absence
Evidence_Assessed: Duration of physical presence, reasons for absence, ongoing economic and familial ties to Canada
Relief_Sought: Grant of citizenship following proper residency assessment
Governing_Rule: Applicants must accumulate at least three years of residence in Canada within four years before applying; temporary absences with maintained ties may be counted
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure by Citizenship judge to consider all relevant factors regarding temporary absence and centrality of life in Canada
Outcome: Appeal granted, case remanded for reassessment
Harm_Assessment: Unjust denial of citizenship due to incomplete legal analysis
Cause_Description: Applicant challenged Citizenship judge's decision denying citizenship based on insufficient residency determination
Evidence_Handling: Court found that key evidence of Canadian ties was not properly weighed
Evidence_Issues: Incomplete evaluation of evidence related to temporary absence and maintained connections
Residency_Compliance: Partially compliant – physical presence below threshold but potential inclusion of temporary absence
Evidence_Assessment: Need for reassessment of evidence regarding ties to Canada during absence
Decision_Rationale: The judge failed to apply the correct legal test regarding temporary absence and centrality of life in Canada
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient consideration of applicant’s ongoing connections to Canada
Legal_Standard_Applied: Test for temporary absence and maintenance of central life in Canada
